document_data.name: Urdo
document_data.mainbody: '''Urdo''' was a prominent merchant family of [[Westgate]] on the [[Dragon Coast]].
document_data.Activities: The Urdo clan ran a mercantile business, some of which was importing [[spice]]s and [[perfume]]s. The Urdo Company had a cutthroat approach to competition. They sough to buy any fledging merchants before they could grow to become a threat. The family mercantile company's bangle was an image of a yellow eye. By the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], the Urdo family was also known as great scholars.
document_data.Possessions:
[[File:House Urdo guard uniform.png|thumb|''A guard of the Urdo family adorned in the house's uniform.'']]
House Urdo's owned a fortified walled and armed called [[Castle Urdo]], located on the southeastern end of [[Westgate Market Street]]. Among other properties of note in the city were the Urdo docks at the end of the [[Brew House Lane]], next to the Urdo Company Sheds. Additionally, the family owned a mansion that faced the [[Market Triangle]].
document_data.Relationships:
House Urdo feuded with [[Shalush Myrkeer]], a prominent 14{{th}} century merchant of Westgate. This long-running opposition stopped Shalush from being elevated to the city's council of lords and formation of his own noble house.

In the {{YearlinkName|1374}}, the Urdo family put their sights on [[Okuzo's Imports]], a new merchant who began dealing in spices and perfumes. Dallia Urdo used unsavory approach and physical abuse, trying to intimidate [[Okuzo]] into selling.
document_data.Members:
*[[Dallia Urdo]], the family's young and ambitious enforcer in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
*[[Haztor Urdo]], a young member of the family in the late 14{{th}} century DR.
*[[Katheera Urdo]], "The Succubus" of the [[Night Masks]] guild in the late 14{{th}} century DR.
*[[Losifan Urdo]], a black sheep of the family and a member of the [[Mercenaries' Guild of Westgate]] in the late 14{{th}} century DR.
*[[Scirkas Urdo]], a member of Westgate's council of merchants in the late 14{{th}} century DR.
*Lord [[Ssentar Urdo]], the patriarch of House Urdo ''circa'' [[1367 DR]].
*[[Torpin Urdo]], the Just Captain of the city watch in the late 15{{th}} century DR.{{Cite dragon/428/Backdrop: Westgate|5-6}}
